intro: Phlomoides bracteosa, commonly known as the bracted phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
